# Block Editor

# Editor Dashboard

The Editor Dashboard is the place where you create, update your blocks.

It's a WYSYWYG dashboard organized as follows:

  • topbar
  • design board
  • toolbar
  • status bar

# Document

Since a block can be a set of blocks we refer to a document as the global block that is composed of different blocks

# Topbar

The Topbar is set to:

  • close the current editor window clicking on the fiber_manual_record icon at the top left of the window
  • preview: full preview of the current document clicking on the fiber_manual_record icon
  • name of the current document, category and unique ID
  • at the right you have a group of icons with the following functions:
    • save save
    • file_copy duplicate or save as
    • web create a new article that will use the document as layout
    • system_update_alt import a reusable block
    • backup export the current document to file (JSON)
    • remove_red_eye preview preview the current document

# Design board

The design board is where the blocks are placed. When you create a new block MOKAStudio automatically create an empty container with a simple text element. It's important to understand the structure that MOKAStudio uses to represent a block and create the correspondent HTML code.

Please read the Block Structure documentation before to proceed.

When blocks are added to the design board, moving the mouse over any block/element a colored dashed border will be displayed. The color codes are:

document block
grid/columns container
flexbox container
all other elements

Clicking on a container/block the border will stay visible, indicating that that block is a current selected one.

When you have a selected element you also have:

  • a floating bar showing at the top left corner of the element itself

  • a toolbar at the bottom of the screen

# Floating bar

Depending on the element selected the floating bar as different icons as a shortcut for common functions. Following icons/actions are available for all elements

  • view_columns icon: indicates the element type. Clicking on the you can replace the element with another type (all data of the current element will be removed)

  • edit (not available for containers) : depending on the current element the edit action can be :

    • edit the text
    • add image
    • select icon

  • brush opens the customizer panel where you can customize your element attributes assigning the TailwindCSS pseudo-classes

  • delete removes the element from the design board. A confirmation modal will be displayed.

If the selected element is a container you will have also the following icons/actions

  • add add an element to the current selection selecting from the elements drawer
  • widgets add a reusable block to the current selection selecting one from the reusables block drawer

# Toolbar

The toolbar is fully available when a block is selected.

The toolbar gives you the tools to for the current selection (left side of the toolbar):

add add an element (available only for containers)

edit edit the current element content (not available for containers)

brush customize the current element design

widgets add a reusable block (available only for containers)

content_copy copy the current element in the clipboard

content_paste paste the copied element to the current element

file_copy duplicate the current element

motion_photos_on set the animation for the current element

archive save current block as reusable block

account_tree display the current element/block tree

delete remove the current element/block

On the right side of the toolbar you have tools for the global document

select_all select the document

add add a new block to the document

widgets add a reusable block to the document

remove_red_eye preview

save save the document

# Status Bar

The status bar gives you info about the current selected element.

From the Status Bar you can also view/update the CSS Classes for the current element.

edit open the CSS classes editor and style editor for the element

brush open the Customizer

# Customizer

The Customizer is the panel that gives you access to the design settings of the current element. It is a powerful panel that converts your settings to TailwindCSS classes.

Go to Block Customizer for a detailed documentation.
